Event.name: Attack
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Assailant</fen> physically attacks a <fen>Victim</fen> (which is usually but not always sentient), causing or intending to cause the <fen>Victim</fen> physical damage. A <fen>Weapon</fen> used by the <fen>Assailant</fen> may also be mentioned, in addition to the usual <fen>Place</fen>, <fen>Time</fen>, <fen>Purpose</fen>, <fen>Explanation</fen>, etc. Sometimes a location is used metonymically to stand for the <fen>Assailant</fen> or the <fen>Victim</fen>, and in such cases the <fen>Place</fen> FE will be annotated on a second FE layer.
<ex><fex name="Time">As soon as he stepped out of the bar</fex> <fex name="Victim">he</fex> was <t>set</t> <fex name="Victim">upon</fex> <fex name="Assailant">by four men in ski-masks</fex>.</ex> <ex>Is <fex name="Asl">he</fex> <t>invading</t> <fex name="Victim">Iraq</fex> <fex name="Purp">just to cover other shortcomings</fex>?</ex> <ex><fex name="Time">Then</fex> <fex name="Assailant">Jon-O's forces</fex> <t>ambushed</t> <fex name="Victim">them</fex> <fex name="Place">on the left flank</fex> <fex name="Source">from a line of low hills</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Victim
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE is the being or entity that is injured by the <fen>Assailant</fen>'s attack. <ex>The mysterious fighter <t>attacked</t> <fex name="Victim">the guardsmen</fex> with a sabre.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Weapon
Arg.definition: <def-root>An entity used by the <fen>Assailant</fen> to cause damage to the <fen>Victim</fen>. <ex>The mysterious fighter <t>attacked</t> the guardsmen <fex name="Weapon">with a sabre</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Assailant
Arg.definition: <def-root>The person (or other self-directed entity) that is attempting physical harm to the <fen>Victim</fen>. <ex><fex name="Assailant">The mysterious fighter</fex> <t>attacked</t> the guardsmen with a sabre.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Assailant</fen> that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Assailant</fen> that accomplishes the assault. <ex><fex name="Assailant">Japanese</fex> <t>ambushed</t> <fex name="Victim">Americans</fex> <fex name="Means">by bombing Pearl Harbor</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the place where the <fen>Assailant</fen> makes an assault on the <fen>Victim</fen>. <ex><fex name="Time">Then</fex> <fex name="Assailant">Jon-O's forces</fex> <t>ambushed</t> <fex name="Victim">them</fex> <fex name="Place">on the left flank</fex> <fex name="Source">from a line of low hills</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which an <fen>Assailant</fen> attacks the <fen>Victim</fen>. <ex>John <t>assaulted</t> Thibault <fex name="Purpose">to prove his manhood</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>A state of affairs that the <fen>Assailant</fen> is responding to that leads them to make an assault on the <fen>Victim</fen>. <ex><fex name="Assailant">Gloria</fex> <t>attacked</t> <fex name="Victim">Michael</fex> <fex name="Exp">for the cause of Justice</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the time when the <fen>Assailant</fen> attacks the <fen>Victim</fen>. <ex><fex name="Time">As soon as he stepped out of the bar</fex> <fex name="Victim">he</fex> was <t>set</t> <fex name="Victim">upon</fex> <fex name="Assailant">by four men in ski-masks</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Source
Arg.definition: <def-root>The starting-point of the motion of the <fen>Assailant</fen> or projectiles of the <fen>Assailant</fen> as they move toward the the <fen>Place</fen> that the <fen>Victim</fen> is occupying in the attack. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context. </def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for any <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing the state of the <fen>Assailant</fen> or <fen>Victim</fen> while the attack occurs. <ex>They <t>attacked</t> us <fex name="Depictive">in large numbers</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Re-encoding
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the <fex name="Re-encoding">Re-encoding</fex>, but not necessarily. </def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Result</fen> of the attack on the <fen>Victim</fen> by the <fen>Assailant</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.</def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Circumstances</fen> describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

Arg.name: Iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The frame element <fex name="Iterations">Iterations</fex> is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held. Form: once, twice, Cardinal expression + /it times, /it lots/a lot </def-root>

Arg.name: Event_description
Arg.definition: <def-root>In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. There are two somewhat distinct subgroups of sentence modifiers that cover this function.</def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Path</fen> refers to (a part of) the ground over which the <fen>Assailant</fen> travels. </def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The number (or description of the number) of times an attack takes place over a period of time.
<ex>They <t>attack</t> daily.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The amount of time that the attack lasts.
<ex>The <fex name="dur">day-long</fex> <t>attack</t> crushed our morale.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Direction
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE is used for expressions that indicate motion along a line from the deitic center towards a reference point (which may be implicit) that is neither the goal of motion nor a landmark along the way.
<ex>They will no doubt launch an <t>attack</t> <fex name="Direction">towards the weakest area of our territory.</fex></ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: attack.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: take aggressive action against.

lexUnit.name: assault.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make an assault on.

lexUnit.name: assault.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a violent attack.

lexUnit.name: attack.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an instance of attacking.

lexUnit.name: fall (upon).v
lexUnit.definition: FN: attack suddenly and forcefully. (used only with PP-upon/on)

lexUnit.name: incursion.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an invasion or attack, especially a sudden or brief one.

lexUnit.name: offensive.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a military campaign of attack.

lexUnit.name: onset.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a military attack.

lexUnit.name: strike.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sudden attack, typically a military one.

lexUnit.name: onslaught.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a fierce or destructive attack.

lexUnit.name: charge.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: rush forward in attack.

lexUnit.name: charge.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a headlong rush forward, typically in attack.

lexUnit.name: lay (into).v
lexUnit.definition: COD: attack violently.

lexUnit.name: set (upon).v
lexUnit.definition: COD: attack (someone) violently. (NB: used only with PP-upon/on.)

lexUnit.name: storm.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of troops) suddenly attack and capture (a place).

lexUnit.name: strike.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: attack suddenly.

lexUnit.name: ambush.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: attack unexpectedly from a concealed position.

lexUnit.name: ambush.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a surprise attack by people lying in wait in a concealed position.

lexUnit.name: jump.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: attack suddenly and unexpectedly.

lexUnit.name: assail.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a concerted or violent attack on.

lexUnit.name: raid.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: conduct a surprise attack

lexUnit.name: bomb.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: attack with a bomb or bombs.

lexUnit.name: bombing.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the act of attacking with a bomb or bombs.

lexUnit.name: raid.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a rapid surprise attack on people or premises.

lexUnit.name: attacker.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: individual who makes an attack.

lexUnit.name: offensive.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a military operation or weapon) involved or used in active attack.

lexUnit.name: infiltrate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to sneak across enemy lines with the intention of spying or attacking

lexUnit.name: infiltration.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the event of infiltrating

lexUnit.name: hit.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to strike.

lexUnit.name: fire.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: attack by projectile weapons.

lexUnit.name: small arms fire.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an attack via small arms such as rifles, revolvers, light machine guns, and grenade launchers.

lexUnit.name: SAF.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an acronym for small arms fire.

lexUnit.name: safire.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: small arms fire.

lexUnit.name: drive-by.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a shooting in which the assailants fire weapons from a vehicle and immediately depart to avoid capture.

lexUnit.name: airstrike.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: attack carried out by aircraft.

lexUnit.name: assailant.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an attacker.

lexUnit.name: bombardment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an attack with launched projectiles and explosives.

lexUnit.name: bombard.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: assail with projectiles and/or explosives.
